headline: Shipping Is the New COGS: Carriers' 2026 Rate Hikes Are Squeezing Ecommerce Margins
summary: As UPS, FedEx, and other major carriers roll out their 2026 rate structures, the ecommerce landscape faces a critical inflection point. With headline General Rate Increases (GRIs) of 5.9% masking effective increases of 10–20% due to surcharges, shipping has ceased to be a simple operational expense. It has evolved into a core component of Cost of Goods Sold (COGS), determining whether online retailers are profitable or merely busy. Ship.com, a leading shipping platform for high-growth brands, to

It has evolved into a core component of Cost of Goods Sold (COGS), determining whether online retailers are profitable or merely busy. thumbnail.caption: "We are here to tell founders that if they don't treat shipping like COGS, they aren't running a business; they are subsidizing a carrier.”

headline: New Ownership of PostalAnnex in Boca Raton, Florida Brings Fresh Perspective on Serving the Community and Boosting Shipping and Office Services
summary: Annex Brands, Inc., a leading franchisor in the packing, shipping, and office services industries, is pleased to announce the successful transfer of ownership of an existing PostalAnnex location in Boca Raton, FL to new owners, Nestor Abad and Ynes Nero. This transition to new ownership ensures that the community will benefit from the essential shipping and office services provided by this PostalAnnex for the last three years.

content.title: New Ownership of PostalAnnex in Boca Raton, Florida Brings Fresh Perspective on Serving the Community and Boosting Shipping and Office Services

This transition to new ownership ensures that the community will benefit from the essential shipping and office services provided by this PostalAnnex for the last three years.

headline: TEAMSTERS SUE UPS FOR BREACH OF NATIONAL CONTRACT
summary: The Teamsters Union filed an emergency motion for a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction against United Parcel Service today, demanding the company shut down its plan to roll out a second illegal buyout scam targeting UPS Teamsters drivers. The package giant has told the union it aims to announce the Driver Choice Program (DCP) this week.

content.title: TEAMSTERS SUE UPS FOR BREACH OF NATIONAL CONTRACT
content.summary: The Teamsters Union filed an emergency motion for a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction against United Parcel Service today, demanding the company shut down its plan to roll out a second illegal buyout scam targeting UPS Teamsters drivers. The package giant has told the union it aims to announce the Driver Choice Program (DCP) this week.

thumbnail.caption: International Brotherhood Of Teamsters. (PRNewsFoto/International Brotherhood of Teamsters)
